intro: Kunthia deppei, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Kunthia deppei typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is a hardy perennial that thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant.
